question: Which type of refrigerant property is important for reducing environmental impact?
Why is part-load efficiency important for chillers in data centers?
options: Because the cooling load fluctuates and chillers often run below full capacity
Because full load is always needed
Because maintenance happens only at full load
Because part load is never used
answer: Because the cooling load fluctuates and chillers often run below full capacity

question: Which of these control strategies helps reduce energy usage in a chiller plant?
options: Running all chillers all the time

options: Risk of downtime if a chiller fails

question: Which is a risk associated with water-cooled chillers in data centers?

question: What is the “lift” in the context of a chiller?
options: Difference between condenser and evaporator pressures/temperatures
answer: Difference between condenser and evaporator pressures/temperatures

options: To detect failures, optimize performance, reduce maintenance costs
To run at max capacity always
answer: To detect failures, optimize performance, reduce maintenance costs

options: Higher capital cost, less efficient operation at part load
answer: Higher capital cost, less efficient operation at part load

question: What is a centrifugal chiller?
options: A type of chiller using centrifugal compressor, generally for large capacities
answer: A type of chiller using centrifugal compressor, generally for large capacities

answer: ~42°F for comfort vs ~47-55°F for data center

question: What role does the condenser pump play in a water-cooled chiller plant?
options: Pumping condenser water to cooling towers
answer: Pumping condenser water to cooling towers

question: Which is true about raising the chilled water loop temperature supply point?
options: It reduces the chiller lift and improves efficiency
It forces the system to use more power
answer: It reduces the chiller lift and improves efficiency

question: Which water-side component helps improve temperature approach in chillers (i.e., reduce the temperature difference between chilled water out and return)?

options: To avoid contamination and maintain water quality
answer: To avoid contamination and maintain water quality

question: Which cooling system configuration can reduce cooling path length and losses in airflow?

answer: Chiller has to do more work (higher lift), efficiency drops

question: Why are variable speed drives (VSDs) used in chiller compressors and pumps in data centers?
options: To match capacity with load and reduce energy use
To run at full speed always
answer: To match capacity with load and reduce energy use

question: Which of these is a standard for data center thermal environment guidelines?
How does free cooling become feasible for a data center?
options: When ambient outside air or cooling tower source is cooler than required chilled water supply
answer: When ambient outside air or cooling tower source is cooler than required chilled water supply

question: What is the benefit of liquid cooling (direct-to-chip / immersion) compared to air cooling in data centers?
options: Better heat removal, higher efficiency, smaller air-handling needed
Only useful in very small data centers
answer: Better heat removal, higher efficiency, smaller air-handling needed

question: Which of these can help reduce energy cost due to utility demand charges in large data centers?
options: Soft-start capability, limiting inrush, spreading chiller startup
answer: Soft-start capability, limiting inrush, spreading chiller startup

question: Why is humidity control important in data center HVAC along with temperature?
options: To avoid static discharge and condensation on equipment
Always keep humidity as high as possible
answer: To avoid static discharge and condensation on equipment

question: What is an economizer mode in chillers related to data centers?
options: Using outside air or cooler external medium to reduce compressor usage
answer: Using outside air or cooler external medium to reduce compressor usage

question: Which kind of sensor data is critical for optimizing chiller plant performance?
What does lift in chiller systems refer to, and why is low lift desirable?
options: Temperature/pressure difference between evaporator and condenser; low lift reduces work for compressor
Height difference of pipes; low height reduces piping cost
Water cleanliness; low lift means cleaner water
answer: Temperature/pressure difference between evaporator and condenser; low lift reduces work for compressor

question: What is the benefit of monitoring chiller plant operations remotely (IoT / BMS)?
options: Predict issues, schedule preventive maintenance, reduce downtime
answer: Predict issues, schedule preventive maintenance, reduce downtime
